alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 2:15PM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches below 7000 feet. Otherwise, snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches except up to 25 inches above 9000 feet. Winds gusting 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 90 mph along the ridges. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 10 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very strong to damaging winds will precede the winter storm warning. Furthermore, there is relatively high uncertainty to snow levels during the main moisture push Tuesday morning. Overall, 4 to 15 inches of heavy/wet snow is possible above 9000 feet before snow levels fall Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
